本身教左英文好多年
分享番d心得

1. 一定要平日接觸多d英文
學語文最講求根底
一定要長期浸
有時見d學生作文連最基本嘅詞語都唔識解
就係因為接觸英文太少
除左睇晒English Grammar in Use
最直接幫到DSE英文都係睇報紙雜誌
因為reading出嘅文章
差唔多全部都係出自報紙雜誌
Writing絕大多數題目都係議論文或者說明文

以下刊物都值得推薦:
South China Morning Post
New York Times
Guardian
Time Magazine
Economist
除左學生字意思
仲要學埋詞性同生字句式搭配
字典例句如果有用抄低埋

Listening方面日日聽明珠台新聞、BBC
同埋睇網上videos
以下類別比較貼近DSE題目
environment
technology
sports
music
health
education
teenage problems
current affairs
有時可以睇下英語電影劇集

2. 一定要保持恆心
有d人知道學英文要浸
但係學唔好英文
就係因為怕悶怕多怕難怕麻煩
求學永遠都係3分鐘熱度
睇報紙雜誌覺得難少少悶少少又好快放棄
我覺得有時諗野要實用d
始終興趣唔可以當飯食
始終依個世界係英文世界
升學做野邊度都要用英文
與其用曬d時間hea、吹水或者玩
不如花d時間接觸英文
同埋興趣係可以培養
越睇得多報紙雜誌
你會發覺呢個世界其實有好多有趣嘅知識
唔一定淨係食飯行街睇戲煲劇追星先有樂趣

3. 學英文一定要對自己要求高
犯過嘅錯一定要檢討
我自己教人英文
會幫學生整錯處列表方便溫習
無論有補習無補習都應該有呢個習慣
唔係次次作文都淨係睇個分
其實好難有進步

最後對唔同類型學生比番建議

英中學生:
英中學生一定唔可以自滿
英中最勁果班人係好有上進心
不但補習仲日日接觸英文
但係有更多人其實好懶
有d vocab底差到同中中學生無異
所以一定要每日努力改進英文

中中學生:
中中學生就更加要努力
因為中中好多科都要中文讀
其實比英中學生學少好多生字
Listening Part A係處於極大劣勢
英中好多人呢part有7成幾以上
但中中學生往往發覺好吃力
所以平時就要更加努力累積vocab
就算係中中有頭幾名
其實唔等於咩
與其自我陶醉
不如諗下點追貼英中學生

Retakers / Repeaters
重讀極需要恆心
我教過有d retakers極度勤力
日日睇英文
每個禮拜交作文
但係差果d就無咩上進心
hea嘅時間仲多過玩
好似享受人生咁
記住retake一定要有背水一戰嘅決心
啊媽係女人

有冇oral心得?
要講d咩先會高分

有冇oral心得?
要講d咩先會高分

每個point有充份引申
Ideas and Organization想6-7分
最好有個人經歷/時事例子/國際例子
同埋唔係自說自話
要回應人地再加以引申

其實香港地學英文嘅態度好唔健康
以前一代人死背書 讀死書
個一代人 長大
部份人做老師
仍然會用自己以前學習個一套去教學
可惜好多野已經改變

學英文為左乜？
正常人係為左同外國人溝通
同世界連接？

如果係為左成績/別人期望 去學係好難學得好
都唔知為左乜？
興趣好重要 學乜都好
無耐我諗好多學生對英文冇興趣 更有小小厭惡

另外
好多人好怕講英文

其實學一重語言 講出聲係好重要
(但係有幾多學生平日會講出聲 除左fuck /shit)

可能香港傳統/歷史影響
另好多人對英文依樣野有種優越感？
講得好/學得好 對講得唔好嘅人有種距離？
有時串錯字又要抄十次廿次。。。
對字典太過倚賴。。。
好多好多 都好on9

讀得好就好落去 讀得差就差落去

改善讀音
可以download好嘅app
可以試下download有道詞典
同埋可以試下學音標

寫Paper
唔好句句SVO
用多d連接詞/連接句式
咩句式都用下
Relative Clause
Participle Clause
Adjective Pattern
Inversion
名詞化
(With the implementation of ...
With the emergence of ...
同埋寫Paper最緊要都係內容
寫之前搜集多d資料
newspapers / magazine articles / academic journals咩都睇下

一定要睇報紙
齋背vocab其實唔夠
報紙除左教你vocab點配搭

Form 6開始睇Time/Economist

一個問題普通學生可能淨係諗到2個points
睇得多報紙雜誌係可以諗到5-6個points同埋無數例子
引申會易如反掌

如carpet/curtain/cupboard/Japan/century
或者Writing出題字眼

好多學生都唔識
呢d情況有乜skills都救唔到

有個自修學生同我講有睇SCMP習慣
但係幾日睇一篇
我即刻笑左
睇太少其實無用
睇英文千祈唔好睇心情
應該要成為生活一部份
玩少陣hea少陣chat少陣
一定抽到時間
keep住日日睇會好好多
又有d人當故仔書咁速讀
咁又係唔得
最好嘅方法就係學習入面常用嘅vocab同expressions
寫入筆記簿𥚃面定期温習
記多幾次作文用番出來
咁先會真正識用

就係擴大知識面

2升4係好少人做到
有能力有毅力嘅人先做到
但係你Listening L2都反映左你vocab底子同listening敏鋭度比較弱
單憑技巧最多都係L4
你呢個L4
最多都係68-69%
同L5 (75%)仲有一定距離
L5同L4係英文好同英文普通嘅分界線
英文無咁上下根底無可能有L5

補習係有好多技巧
我自己都會教學生作文思維
教學生Reading同Listening搵答案

但有好多人根本連一d最基本grammar同vocab都無
is/am/are/do/does都唔識分
連解題都有困難
單憑技巧根本無用
所以我會更加著重打好學生根底
每次改作文都有詳細改文筆記
希望DSE成績會好又會終身受用

樓主好有心

我repeat DSE 果年都好俾心機温英文，最後由3變4，全部subgrade 都升左1級。

我對學生字(作文用)都有啲心得：個量要適中，如其學好多但又吾運用到，倒不如精，千其吾好一日睇好多文然後抄好多字諗住學，最好一日6個左右，可能2～3日就係學果6個，再隔排溫。

其實有個小tips, 就係吾好搵太多不同種類來源，你睇開scmp 就scmp, young post 就youngpost， 你睇開一個媒體既文章，你會發現佢地會用差不多既字 大概啦。咁記憶會深好多。

我都建議down 政府新聞網，手機隨時睇，又不太長 仲有時事學。

writing question analysis嗰個word file macbook開唔到 anyway thanks
btw其實應該點去諗idea? (argumentative essays) 成日idea嗰個分都好差

DSE Writing Tips - Content (內容)
1. 舉例
2. 分析原因 / 影響
3. 正反對比 / 古今對比
4. 層遞
more tourists --> boost the development of tourism --> boost the economy --> more jobs
5. 分類法
short term // long term
primary school kids // secondary school students // university students
junior form students // senior form students
6. 引用權威
例如: South China Morning Post // The University of Hong Kong

DSE Writing Tips - Language
1. 文法準確
2. 配詞準確
3. vocab多元 (同義詞 /轉Parts of Speech)
4. 句式多元
(Cleft Sentences / Relative Clauses / Participle Clauses / Inversions / Rhetorical Sentences)
5. 語氣準確
Letter to the Principal: Formal (語氣恭敬)
Feature Article: Semi-formal (多和讀者互動 + 感情色彩)

DSE Writing Tips - Organization
1. 標題交代全文主旨/立場
2. 句與句之間要有聯繫，不能夠句句SVO，用連接詞、Relative Clauses、Participle Clauses連接
3. 每段第1句用標題句交代段旨
4. 每段最後1句重申段旨
5. 用過渡段承上啟下
6. 下文呼應上文
7. 首尾呼應
8. 內文呼應標題，重提標題關鍵字眼
9. 全文首尾，每段首尾扣題，重提題目關鍵字眼
10. Part A短文每個部份之間環環相扣
11. 問題和建議數目要均衡，2個問題就要有2個建議，建議針對問題

2017 Part A Q1
You are the chairperson of the Social Service Club in your school. The school would like to develop closer links with the community. Write a letter to your principal, Ms Lee, proposing a new community project that the school can carry out with a home for the elderly in your district.
In your letter persuade your principal to accept your project by
(i) describing one activity that could be carried out, and
(ii) identifying the benefits for the elderly home.
Sign your letter Chris Wong.

Dear Mr. Lee,

I am writing to propose a new community project for our school on behalf of the Social Service Club. Knowing that our school is aiming to develop closer links with the community, our club has come up with a project named “Warmth to the Elderly” in collaboration with an elderly home called “Sunny Nursing Home”. In the following, I would like to introduce an activity of the project and the benefits for the elderly home, hoping that the school will find it meaningful to run.

After our discussion with “Sunny Nursing Home”, it is suggested that a computer class can be organized for the elderly there. As we all know, the senior citizens in the elderly home sometimes feel lonely and depressed. With their loved ones being preoccupied with work and study, they are in lack of opportunities to connect to the outside world. In view of this, a computer class would be a therapeutic activity for the elderly. Our students are proficient in the use of information technology and advanced electronic gadgets. They could be the instructors in the class, teaching the senior citizens to carry out simple computer operations and use basic functions on the computers, such as typing Chinese characters, surfing the net and watching videos and TV dramas. Through this class can our students help the aged reconnect to the world outside the elderly home. For example, they could learn how to use Gmail and various social media websites like Facebook and Weibo to communicate with their children and grandchildren. With a view to enlarging their social network, they can even make new friends on these websites. It is also worth noting that the elderly can keep abreast of the events happening in the world and entertain themselves with the IT skills acquired from the class. As senior citizens are easily exhausted and their attention span is short, it is recommended that each training session should last for one hour.

There are several benefits that the project of “Warmth to the Elderly” can bring to the elderly home. To commence with, the project can enhance the atmosphere of the elderly home, making it more harmonious.Lacking warmth and love, the senior citizens in the elderly home often feel spiritually empty and hopeless. Without any means to express their dissatisfaction and frustration, it is not uncommon for them to lose temper. Last month, for example, an elderly man fought with another old lady in the elderly home and both of them suffered from injuries. It is our firm belief that the computer course can address this problem and improve the atmosphere of the elderly home. As mentioned above, the class can enable the senior citizens to communicate with their loved ones. With their fragile souls warmed by their children and grandchildren, they will be spiritually fulfilled and have better mental well-being. As a result, tempers are less likely to flare and conflicts among the senior citizens can be minimized. With the harmonious atmosphere in Sunny Nursing Home, the workload of the staff can be lightened, smoothening the operation of the elderly home.

Equally worth noting is that our community project can enhance the reputation of the elderly home. Unlike some elderly homes in Hong Kong, the mission of Sunny Nursing Home is to “provide senior citizens with warmth and a fruitful life”. Through organizing this meaningful computer course and connecting the elderly to the outside world can we achieve this goal. With media coverage and online discussion, the residents in our neighbourhood and Hong Kong will know about the details of the project, realizing that the staff members of the elderly home are enthusiastic about helping the aged and do their utmost to provide a harmonious and blissful environment for them. With a better reputation, the elderly home can entice more people to send their elderly parents there, increasing its customer base and revenue in the long run.

It is high time for us to make the first step to develop closer links with the community. It is sincerely hoped that our proposal will be adopted by the school, benefitting the elderly as well as the elderly home. Thank you for your attention.


Yours sincerely,
Chris Wong
Chairman of Social Service Club

HKDSE English 2017 Q7
Learning English through Social Issues
You are working on a project entitled “Hong Kong’s NEETs”. NEETs are young people who are not in education, employment or training. Many of these young people spend their time at home playing video games or surfing the Internet.
Write a report to explain why the number of NEETs in Hong Kong is rising and suggest what can be done to help these youths. Give reasons to support your suggestions.

Hong Kong’s NEETs

Introduction

In recent years, the rising tide of NEETs has raised concerns in our society. Flipping through newspapers, we can easily see the news of socially withdrawn youths burying themselves in the latest gadgets and being reluctant to find jobs. With these hapless teens being condemned by the public, it is time we investigated the reasons behind the phenomenon, figuring out the ways to bail them out.

Reasons
1. The promotion of tertiary education
To start with, the phenomenon can be ascribed to the government’s promotion of tertiary education, which has led to the intensifying competition in the job market.In the 2000s, the former Chief Executive Tung Chee Hwa proposed several schemes to increase the number of blue-collar and high-tech workers through implementing several policies including increasing the number of places of high-diploma students. As a result, the number of fresh graduates from tertiary education has been skyrocketing to an unprecedented level, causing the inflation of academic qualifications. Nowadays, even if a student strives to excel academically to get a ticket to a university, what is waiting for them may be unemployment as the job market cannot accommodate every graduate with high academic qualifications. Besides, those who have studied industriously for 15 years are unwilling to accept low-income jobs with filthy and undesirable conditions. With this mismatch in the labour market, some young people may opt to stay at home awaiting better employment opportunities and be reluctant to join the retraining programmes organized by the Vocational Training Council. Based on the above, it is the government’s policies in promoting tertiary education that has contributed to the surging tide of NEETs in Hong Kong.

2. Helicopter parenting
Apart from government policies, helicopter parents have also exacerbated the problem of NEETs by pampering their young children.The term “Kong Kids” is used to describe those children who fail to deal with obstacles and have low self-esteem. They are likely to be bred by helicopter parents who stand by them whenever they are beset with troubles. Treating their children as priceless pearls, these helicopter parents pamper them with comfortable lifestyles and dare not provide precious chances for them to learn to be independent. According to a recent article in the South China Morning Post, more and more youngsters regard their overprotective parents as their saviors to solve every problem and are financially reliant on the latter. As a consequence, the pampered children tend to immerse themselves in greenhouses and can hardly overcome the challenges in the workplace. However well-intentioned the helicopter parents are, they have contributed to more socially-withdrawn youths who are not in education, employment or training.

With education policies and helicopter parenting aggravating the problem of NEETs, it is crucial for different stakeholders to alleviate the problem.

Recommendations

1. Promoting the development of various industries
It is suggested that the government should encourage the development of various industries which can provide employment opportunities for the NEETs.
The saturation of the job market can be attributed to the over-emphasis on real estate industry and financial industries. If the government does its utmost to make the creative industry and the IT industry thrive, some youngsters can find their dream jobs in various fields. This can, to a certain extent alleviate the problem of NEETs. With the provision of more subsidies and implenentation of preferential policies, the government can enable media and information technology companies to expand their business, learn from their foreign counterparts and invest more on research and development. With more enterprises being capable of competing in the global market, they will have the financial power to employ the young talents graduating from high diploma and undergraduate programmes. Instead of staying at home and escaping from reality, youngsters will be able to realize their potential and pursue their dreams.

2. Allowing youngsters to be independent from parents
It is also recommended that the helicopter parents should allow their children to be the masters of their own destiny. The youngsters’ lack of problem-solving skills and pessimistic outlook on life are associated with helicopter parenting. Therefore, the parents in Hong Kong should learn a lesson from the phenomenon of NEETs, letting their children overcome challenges on their own. For example, never should parents financially support them if the latter refuse to search for jobs. Rather than assisting their children to tackle every problem, parents should allow them to find the prescriptions. In making important decisions, such as the choice of extra-curricular activities, the selection of elective subjects in senior forms and the selection of university programmes in Jupas applications, parents should only play the roles of advisors and respect the aspirations of their children.Thanks to the declining influence from parents, our next generation can hone their logical thinking and critical thinking. Being more confident of themselves, youngsters will be determined and persistent in leaping over the countless hurdles in their life journey instead of living in the greenhouse provided by their overprotective parents.

Conclusion

The above are the reasons leading to the phenomenon of NEETs and the solutions to the problem.It is to be hoped that the government and parents can adopt pragmatic approaches to prevent our next generation becoming socially withdrawn. With their concerted effort, young graduates will become the masters of their destiny, leading fruitful lives and contributing to the development of Hong Kong.

本身教左英文好多年
分享番d心得

1. 一定要平日接觸多d英文
學語文最講求根底
一定要長期浸
有時見d學生作文連最基本嘅詞語都唔識解
就係因為接觸英文太少
除左睇晒English Grammar in Use
最直接幫到DSE英文都係睇報紙雜誌
因為reading出嘅文章
差唔多全部都係出自報紙雜誌
Writing絕大多數題目都係議論文或者說明文

以下刊物都值得推薦:
South China Morning Post
New York Times
Guardian
Time Magazine
Economist
除左學生字意思
仲要學埋詞性同生字句式搭配
字典例句如果有用抄低埋

Listening方面日日聽明珠台新聞、BBC
同埋睇網上videos

environment
technology
sports
music
health
education
teenage problems
current affairs
